item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. "Four Seconds to Hot Up the Disintegrator, Google Had Told Me It Wasn't Enough" (141 points | 50 comments)
2. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (41 points | 14 comments)
3. Dozens of Hezbollah members said to be seriously injured as devices explode (129 points | 51 comments)
4. Rio-labs/rio: WebApps in pure Python. No JavaScript, HTML and CSS needed (89 points | 61 comments)
5. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (23 points | 17 comments)
6. The Centrality of Stupidity in Mathematics (129 points | 61 comments)
7. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (63 points | 4 comments)
8. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (45 points | 24 comments)
9. Signatures of Gravitational Atoms from Black Hole Mergers (64 points | 16 comments)
10. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (97 points | 14 comments)
11. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (406 points | 71 comments)
12. Advice on Reading Homer in Translation (32 points | 13 comments)
13. Java 23 / JDK 23: General Availability (24 points | 1 comment)
14. A Curried Composition Puzzle (46 points | 5 comments)
15. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (46 points | 13 comments)
16. Tiny Trackers Are Revealing the Secret Lives of Birds (25 points | 6 comments)
17. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (21 points | 4 comments)
18. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (18 points | 9 comments)
19. An interactive core memory electronic kit (18 points | 1 comment)
20. Show HN: Waulog – A digital companion for dog owners (4 points | 4 comments)
21. Show HN: Electrico – Electron Without Node and Chrome (Rust / Wry) (156 points | 62 comments)
22. The Theft of a Priceless Churchill Portrait (32 points | 11 comments)
23. Ncomm – A node-based robotics framework written in Rust (42 points | 15 comments)
24. Chain of Thought empowers transformers to solve inherently serial problems (229 points | 149 comments)
25. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (309 points | 137 comments)
26. Ask HN: Is a Masters in CS/Engineering worth it for a mid-career PM? (47 points | 63 comments)
27. Why is it so hard to go back to the moon? (26 points | 22 comments)
28. Can Generative Multi-Agents Spontaneously Form a Society? (10 points | discuss)
29. IBM acquires Kubecost (12 points | 2 comments)
30. Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week (1373 points | 1641 comments)
